title: Backward Design and Lateral Thinking Integrated Math Course for Fostering Creative Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical concepts and practical experience in specialized fields (medical/legal/technical)
context.additional_context: Conducted in a BYOD environment, focusing on enhancing creative problem-solving skills for learners with diverse cognitive styles (dependent/independent)

learning_goals: Backward Design and Lateral Thinking techniques can be integrated to solve real-world math problems.
Analyze complex mathematical problems from diverse perspectives (internal/external stimuli) to derive creative solutions
Understand peers' diverse thinking styles and develop integrative approaches through team-based activities

resources: Digital collaboration tools (Google Jamboard, Miro, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
